intro: Pichisermollodes fraser-jenkinsii, commonly known as the Fraser-Jenkins' pichisermollodes, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often compound leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its flowers are small and clustered, often white or pale yellow, and it produces small, dry fruits. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
